meanings.definition: The action or process of forming or being formed into layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratifications of the cake layers made it look beautiful and delicious.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study the stratifications of rocks to understand the Earth's history.
meanings.sent3: The stratifications of the sandwich layers were so neat that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The artist used different colors to represent the stratifications of emotions in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The stratifications of the soil revealed the passage of time through distinct layers.

meanings.definition: A layer or layers of rock or sediment with characteristics that differ from adjacent layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratifications in the cliff showed different colors and textures in each layer.
meanings.sent2: Fossils can often be found in the stratifications of sedimentary rocks.
meanings.sent3: The stratifications in the rock formation resembled a colorful staircase.
meanings.sent4: The stratifications of the mountain revealed its geological history.
meanings.sent5: The stratifications of the sandstone layers created a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or classification of something into different groups or levels.
meanings.sent1: The social stratifications in the community were evident in the way people interacted.
meanings.sent2: The stratifications of the data helped in organizing the information effectively.
meanings.sent3: The stratifications of the bookshelves made it easy to find specific books.
meanings.sent4: In the stratifications of society, everyone has a place based on their role.
meanings.sent5: The stratifications of the plants based on their height created a visually appealing garden.
